context:
The text provides information about cookies used on the College websites. Here's a factual summary:

- Cookies are small text files stored on your computer or mobile device when visiting a webpage or application.
- There are two types of cookies: session and persistent.
- Session cookies store temporary information that is deleted when you close your browser.
- Persistent cookies enable the site to recognize you when you return and remain until you delete them.
- The College websites use both types of cookies for a relatively short time duration, with data either stored anonymously or in accordance with their Privacy Policy.
- Users can choose whether to accept cookies or not within their browser settings.
- The text also includes contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-555-559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Social media hub links are provided for additional information.
- The text mentions that the information on the website is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation or warranty.
